page.title: 06LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: A long barrow and several tumuli are evidence of stone age and bronze age settlement, and a major Roman site has been recently excavated. The earliest written reference is the Domesday Book which records that"IN CHINGSCOTE 4 1/2 HIDES"had belonged to King Edwards estates at Berkley. This figure agrees well with the 730 hectares of the present parish. {Religion.} The parish church is dated to the 12th c. but has known many alterations since and suffered major restoration in the 19th c. the tower is largely intact from the 13th or 14th c. {Biography.} Edward Jenner(small pox vaccine)married Catherine Kingscote here in 1788. Her family held the manor from the 12th c. to 1956, but in 1807 built a Georgian mansion"The Grange" and a racecourse in the park.
